What has keys but can’t open locks?
What has hands but can’t clap?
What gets wetter the more it dries?
What has an eye but cannot see?
What can travel around the world while staying in one corner?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
I’m tall when I’m young and short when I’m old. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What is it?
What has a head and a tail but no body?
What has many teeth but can’t bite?
What runs but never walks, has a bed but never sleeps, and a mouth but never eats?
What can you catch but not throw?
What has one eye but can’t see?
What is always coming but never arrives?
What breaks but never falls, and what falls but never breaks?
What goes up but never comes down?
What has a neck but no head?
What has words but never speaks?
What has a ring but no finger?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
What can you hold in your left hand but not in your right?
What has legs but doesn’t walk?
What has a thumb and four fingers but is not alive?
What kind of band never plays music?
What begins with T, ends with T, and has T in it?
What has a bottom at the top?
What has a face and two hands but no arms or legs?
What has an endless supply of letters but starts empty?
What is full of holes but still holds water?
What can’t be used until it’s broken?
What goes up when rain comes down?
What has cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and rivers but no water?
What is so fragile that saying its name breaks it?
What can you see once in a year, twice in a week, and never in a day?
What has four wheels and flies?
What is yours but others use it more than you do?
What has a heart that doesn’t beat?
What has a spine but no bones?
What has an ear but cannot hear?
What has a bark but no bite?
What has a tail but no body?
What can’t talk but will reply when spoken to?
What has a bed but never sleeps?
What comes down but never goes up?
What can run but never tires?
What is found in the middle of nowhere?
What gets bigger the more you take away?
What has 13 hearts but no other organs?
What has a head, a tail, is brown, and has no legs?
What is easy to lift but hard to throw?
What can you keep after giving to someone?
What is black when it’s clean and white when it’s dirty?
What has a tongue but cannot taste?
What has a mouth but cannot speak?
What has a lock but no key?
What is always in front of you but can’t be seen?
What can be cracked, made, told, and played?
What can you make that no one—not even you—can see?
What has a shadow but no body?
What has a roof but no walls?
What is made of water but if you put it in water it dies?
What is taken before you can get it?
What has two banks but no money?
What has a foot but no legs?
What has a needle but doesn’t sew?
What has a palm but no fingers?
What can be heard but not seen?
What has a cape but isn’t a hero?
What is as light as a feather, yet no one can hold it for long?
What is thrown out when needed and taken in when not needed?
What can you break without touching it?
What has four fingers and a thumb but isn’t alive?
What goes through cities and fields but never moves?
What has a lot of eyes but can’t see?
What has one head, one foot, and four legs?
What has six faces but doesn’t wear makeup?
What has a single voice but can sing in many tones?
What has an end but no beginning?
What has no life but can die?
What has no weight but can be heavy?
What has no wings but can fly?
What comes after lightning but before thunder?
What belongs to you but is used by others?
What is the quietest thing in the world?
What has one letter but two words?
What is greater than God, more evil than the devil, the poor have it, the rich need it, and if you eat it you’ll die?
What can be swallowed but can also swallow you?
What has a head but no brain?
What can be measured but not seen?
What is cut on a table but is never eaten?
What has keys but can’t type?
What is bought to eat but never eaten?
What gets sharper the more you use it?
What has a tail that wags but isn’t a dog?
